intro: Chenolea muricata, commonly known as the roughleaf chenolea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
